channel.title: Anyone knows how to make a php/html script show who is online on my server?
channel.description: title says all, basically i just want a little script to check who is online and how much players would be nice too. help is appreciated :D

item.title: Anyone knows how to make a php/html script show who is online on my server?
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

[quote=“djdoyle1, post:3, topic:387236”]Simple version…

[code]

<?php $sock = @fsockopen("yourip", 43594, $errno, $errstr, 1); if($sock) { echo 'Up!'; } else { echo 'Down...'; } ?>

[/code][/quote]it was how many players are online, not if the server is online
but still i’d probably use that code too

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone knows how to make a php/html script show who is online on my server?

<?php $sock = @fsockopen("yourip", 43594, $errno, $errstr, 1); if($sock) { echo 'Up!'; } else { echo 'Down...'; } ?>

Sorry, you appear to be wrong.

item.source: Anyone knows how to make a php/html script show who is online on my server?

item.title: Anyone knows how to make a php/html script show who is online on my server?
item.dc:creator: @djdoyle1 djdoyle1
item.description:
@djdoyle1 wrote:

Simple version…

<?php
      $sock = @fsockopen("yourip", 43594, $errno, $errstr, 1);

      if($sock) {
            echo 'Up!';
      } else {
            echo 'Down...';
      }
?>

EDIT: Oh, sorry. I read it wrong, I thought it was to check if it was online, not to check how many players it had.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone knows how to make a php/html script show who is online on my server?

item.title: Anyone knows how to make a php/html script show who is online on my server?
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][PHP]

<? $connection = mysql_connect('localhost', 'root', 'pass') or die ('Error connecting to mysql'); mysql_select_db('server'); $count = mysql_query('SELECT count FROM server'); if (!$count) { die('Could not query:' . mysql_error()); } echo mysql_result($count, 0); mysql_close($connection); ?>

[/PHP]

[code=Java]
import java.sql.;
import javax.sql.;

public class DBConnection {
public static void main(String args[]) {
String server = “”;
String database = “”;
String dbUrl = “jdbc:mysql://” + server + “/” + database;
String dbClass = “com.mysql.jdbc.Driver”;
String query = “INSERTINTO count VALUES (” + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(); + “)”;
try {
Class.forName(dbClass);
Connection con = DriverManager.getConnection(dbUrl);
Statement stmt = con.createStatement();
stmt.executeQuery(query);
con.close();
} catch(ClassNotFoundException e) {
e.printStackTrace();
} catch(SQLException e) {
e.printStackTrace();
}
}
}[/code]I believe that’s should do the trick. However, the PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(); method may need to be altered to your actual method to get the player count, I only guessed.[/quote]thank you vain

Read full topic
